definitions: simple sugar that serves as the primary energy source for living cells
examples: Diabetics must monitor their blood glucose levels
Glucose provides energy for brain function
The doctor ordered a glucose tolerance test
Plants produce glucose through photosynthesis

definitions: sticky substance used for joining things together permanently
examples: Apply glue to both surfaces before pressing together
The children used glue for their art project
Wood glue creates a strong bond between pieces
Let the glue dry completely before handling

definitions: excessive supply or amount of something
examples: A glut of tomatoes drove prices down
The market faced a glut of unsold inventory
Oil glut led to falling gas prices
Publishers worried about a glut of similar books

definitions: protein found in wheat and related grains that gives dough elasticity
examples: People with celiac disease cannot digest gluten
Gluten gives bread its chewy texture
The restaurant offers a gluten-free menu
Gluten forms when flour is mixed with water

definitions: habitual greed or excess in eating; one of the seven deadly sins
examples: Medieval paintings often depicted gluttony as sin
His gluttony led to serious health problems
The feast descended into gluttony and excess
Gluttony was considered a moral failing

definitions: form of glucose stored in the liver and muscles for energy
examples: Athletes deplete glycogen stores during marathons
The liver converts glycogen back to glucose
Carbohydrate loading increases glycogen storage
Muscles use glycogen for quick energy

definitions: pictographic or symbolic character or carving, especially in ancient writing
examples: Mayan glyphs revealed their complex calendar system
Each glyph represented a word or concept
The stone was covered with mysterious glyphs
Archaeologists decoded the ancient glyphs

definitions: small two-winged fly that often forms swarms
examples: Gnats swarmed around the porch light
A gnat flew into my eye while cycling
The humid weather brought out clouds of gnats
Gnats are attracted to moisture and sweet smells

definitions: decorative garden statue of a bearded dwarf
legendary dwarfish creature living underground
examples: She placed a ceramic gnome in her garden
Garden gnomes originated in Germany
In folklore, gnomes guard underground treasures
The story featured helpful gnomes in the forest

definitions: large African antelope with curved horns, also called wildebeest
examples: Herds of gnu migrate across the Serengeti
The gnu has a distinctive beard and mane
Lions often prey on young gnu
Thousands of gnu cross the river annually

definitions: stick with pointed end for prodding cattle
examples: The farmer used a goad to move the oxen
Ancient plowmen carried goads for their animals
The elephant trainer held a traditional goad
Metal goads replaced wooden ones over time

definitions: player who defends the goal in hockey
examples: The goalie made an incredible save
Our team needs a backup goalie
The goalie wore special protective equipment
She dreams of being a professional goalie

definitions: player who defends the goal in soccer or similar sports
examples: The goalkeeper dove to stop the penalty kick
Each team has one goalkeeper on the field
An injured goalkeeper can be replaced
The goalkeeper wore a different colored jersey

definitions: player who defends the goal, especially in hockey
examples: The goaltender faced forty shots
Teams often pull their goaltender for an extra attacker
The rookie goaltender impressed the coaches
Goaltenders require quick reflexes

definitions: drinking glass or cup with a foot and stem
examples: Wine was served in crystal goblets
The medieval goblet was made of pewter
She raised her goblet in a toast
Antique silver goblets decorated the table

definitions: small, ugly, mischievous creature in folklore
examples: Goblins supposedly steal household items
The children dressed as goblins for Halloween
Fantasy stories often feature goblins as villains
Goblins lived in the dark forest

definitions: man who sponsors a child at baptism
head of a crime organization or influential leader
examples: His godfather gave him a special gift
I asked my brother to be my son's godfather
The movie depicted a powerful mafia godfather
He was considered the godfather of jazz

definitions: woman who sponsors a child at baptism
examples: Her godmother attended every birthday party
The fairy godmother granted three wishes
My godmother taught me to knit
She asked her sister to be the godmother

definitions: male child in relation to his godparents
examples: His godson visited every summer
The godfather left money to his godson
My godson just graduated from college
He treats his godson like his own child

definitions: person who regularly attends or participates in something
examples: She's a regular theater-goer
Church-goers filled the pews on Sunday
Party-goers danced until dawn
Concert-goers waited hours for tickets

definitions: act of leaving or departing
conditions for travel or progress
examples: His going was sudden and unexpected
The going will be tough in this weather
The going rate for tutors is fifty dollars
When the going gets tough, the tough get going

definitions: plant with clusters of small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer
examples: Fields of goldenrod announced autumn's arrival
Goldenrod pollen causes allergies for some
The goldenrod attracted butterflies and bees
Native Americans used goldenrod medicinally

definitions: small yellow and black songbird
examples: A goldfinch perched on the thistle
Goldfinches love nyjer seed feeders
The male goldfinch has bright yellow plumage
European goldfinches have red faces

definitions: small orange or yellow fish commonly kept as a pet
examples: The goldfish swam circles in its bowl
Children won goldfish at the carnival
Goldfish can live for many years
The pond contained colorful goldfish

definitions: mine where gold is extracted; source of great wealth or profit
examples: The old goldmine had been abandoned for decades
That website is a goldmine of information
Prospectors searched for the legendary goldmine
The business proved to be a goldmine

definitions: craftsperson who makes items from gold and precious metals
examples: The goldsmith crafted beautiful wedding rings
Medieval goldsmiths served as early bankers
She apprenticed with a master goldsmith
The goldsmith repaired the antique brooch

definitions: creature from Jewish folklore made of clay and brought to life
examples: The rabbi created a golem to protect the community
The golem of Prague is a famous legend
In the story, the golem turned against its creator
Modern fiction often features golems

definitions: person who plays golf
examples: Professional golfers compete for millions
The golfer selected her club carefully
Weekend golfers crowded the course
Tiger Woods became the world's top golfer

definitions: activity or sport of playing golf
examples: They went golfing every Saturday morning
Golfing requires patience and practice
His golfing improved with lessons
Corporate golfing events are common

definitions: biblical giant defeated by David
any person or thing of enormous size or power
examples: David defeated Goliath with a slingshot
The story of David and Goliath inspires underdogs
The small company faced a corporate goliath
He was a goliath in the tech industry

definitions: traditional flat-bottomed boat used in Venice
enclosed cabin suspended from cables
examples: Tourists rode gondolas through Venice canals
The gondolier sang while steering
The ski gondola carried skiers up the mountain
They rode the gondola to the summit

definitions: metal disc that produces sound when struck
examples: The dinner gong summoned guests
She struck the gong to begin meditation
The orchestra's gong created dramatic effect
Temple gongs called monks to prayer

definitions: sexually transmitted bacterial infection
examples: Antibiotics can treat gonorrhea effectively
Regular testing helps detect gonorrhea early
Untreated gonorrhea can cause serious complications
Health clinics provide gonorrhea screening

definitions: sticky or slimy substance
examples: Mystery goo covered the kitchen counter
The snail left a trail of goo
Children love playing with goo
Industrial goo clogged the drain

definitions: expression used when parting or leaving
examples: She waved goodbye from the window
Saying goodbye is always difficult
The children shouted goodbye to their teacher
He left without saying goodbye

definitions: friendly, helpful, or cooperative feelings
established reputation of a business beyond tangible assets
examples: The treaty promoted goodwill between nations
She performed the service out of goodwill
The company's goodwill was worth millions
Customer goodwill takes years to build

definitions: something attractive or desirable, especially something sweet to eat
examples: Party bags contained various goodies
The bakery displayed tempting goodies
Children eagerly awaited their goodies
She packed healthy goodies for the trip

definitions: foolish mistake or blunder
silly or foolish person
examples: His goof cost the team the game
Everyone makes a goof sometimes
Don't be such a goof!
The class goof made everyone laugh

definitions: hired thug or bodyguard; stupid or foolish person
examples: The villain's goons chased the hero
Corporate goons intimidated the workers
Security goons blocked the entrance
Don't act like a goon at the party

definitions: large waterbird with long neck, webbed feet
examples: A goose honked loudly at the intruder
Wild geese flew south for winter
The farmer raised geese for their down
Mother Goose nursery rhymes are famous

definitions: small, round, edible berry that grows on thorny bushes
examples: Gooseberry pie needs lots of sugar
The green gooseberries were too sour
She made gooseberry jam every summer
Wild gooseberries grew along the path

definitions: small burrowing rodent with cheek pouches
examples: Gophers destroyed the garden with their tunnels
The gopher popped up from its hole
Farmers consider gophers serious pests
Gopher mounds dotted the lawn

definitions: blood shed from violence; graphic violence
examples: The horror movie was full of gore
Crime scene gore shocked the officers
Some viewers can't handle gore in films
The battle left gore on the field

definitions: narrow valley between hills or mountains with steep sides
examples: The river carved a deep gorge
They hiked through the scenic gorge
Waterfalls cascaded down the gorge walls
The bridge spanned the rocky gorge

definitions: largest living primate, native to African forests
examples: Mountain gorillas are critically endangered
The silverback gorilla led his family group
Gorillas are surprisingly gentle giants
Zoo visitors watched the gorillas play

definitions: young goose
examples: Fluffy goslings followed their mother
The gosling struggled to keep up
Spring brought new goslings to the pond
Canada geese goslings stay with parents

definitions: fine, filmy substance like cobwebs; anything light and delicate
examples: Morning dew clung to gossamer spider webs
Her gossamer dress floated in the breeze
Gossamer wings carried the fairy
The gossamer curtains filtered soft light
